alert.note: Alert for Mahnomen; Norman (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 2:53PM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Minnesota, including the following counties, Mahnomen and Norman. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 252 PM CDT, emergency management reported overland flooding was reported by emergency amnagement across portions of Norman County and western Mahnomen County. Flooding is expected to become more widespread as snowmelt continues. Rapid snowmelt is occurring and will continue to cause flooding. - Ongoing snowmelt will continue to lead to widespread flooding impacts throughout the next week. This may include road closures, washouts, and other snowmelt related flooding impacts. Precipitation may exacerbate these impacts.
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
